title: Jesus Was Not Born on Decemeber 25th! Cliffe Knechtle Debates
description:
Was Jesus born on Decemeber 25th? 
This debate challenges the claim that Jesus is just another recycled myth, no different from figures like Mithras or Horus. The student argues these pagan gods were born of virgins, crucified, and resurrected long before Jesus, raising the question of why Christianity should be trusted at all.

Cliffe Knechtle starts with a key correction. The Bible never says Jesus was born on December 25th. That date is a later church tradition, not a biblical claim. From there, he addresses the larger historical issue. The Gospels were written in the first century by eyewitnesses or those closely connected to them and were quoted by early Christian leaders within decades, not centuries.

Unlike pagan stories that describe symbolic or spiritual resurrections developed long after the fact, the Gospels make a clear historical claim. Jesus physically died and physically rose from the dead. The real question is not the holiday. It is the identity of Jesus.

title: Jesus' Face Appears Miraculously on Artwork ‚úùÔ∏è
description:
Artist Diana Watt made an extraordinary discovery while working on one of her wood burned portraits. Known for her intricate woodburning art, Diana was finishing the back of a Jesus portrait when she noticed something unexplainable: a negative image of Jesus appeared on the back of the thick wood panel.  

What makes this event even more remarkable is that the wood was too thick for the burning process to have transferred through to the other side, leaving many questioning whether this is a miracle or an incredible coincidence. The image bears a striking resemblance to the Shroud of Turin; a centuries-old linen cloth believed by many to bear the negative image of Jesus Christ.

Diana shared this discovery on TikT0k, where her video (@dianarockssunshine) quickly gained attention for its mysterious and awe-inspiring nature.  

What do you think of it?

title: God Saved Me: Officer‚Äôs Miraculous Escape from Nashville Tragedy ‚úùÔ∏è
description:
James Wells, a heroic Nashville police officer, found himself at the center of a life-altering moment during the 2020 Christmas Day bombing. Wells was part of the first responders investigating the eerie situation when an RV parked downtown began broadcasting a warning to evacuate. Moments before the explosion, as he approached a fellow officer, Wells described hearing a voice in his head telling him to turn around and walk away. Obeying the instinct, he moved just far enough to escape the full force of the blast, though he was still thrown to the ground.

In an emotional interview, Wells reflected on the divine intervention that he believes saved his life. Fighting through tears, he shared how his faith in God carried him through the chaos. "That voice was God, and it saved me," Wells declared, giving credit to his deeply held beliefs. After the blast, Wells sprinted to his fellow officer, ultimately embracing them in a moment of gratitude and survival.

Wells‚Äôs story has inspired many as a testament to faith and courage. He reminds others that in the darkest moments, there can be a guiding light. His unwavering belief continues to serve as a powerful example of hope amid devastation.

All Glory To God ‚úùÔ∏è

title: Cliffe Knechtle DEBATES Matt Dillahunty | Is God Real?
description:
In this compelling debate at Texas State University, Christian apologist Cliffe Knechtle and renowned atheist Matt Dillahunty confront one of life‚Äôs biggest questions: Is belief in the Christian God rational? Cliffe, a respected Christian pastor, argues for God‚Äôs existence using evidence from the Big Bang, DNA as a sign of intelligent design, and the historical resurrection of Jesus. He contends that humanity‚Äôs search for meaning and love points to a divine creator, making faith in Christ a logical choice.

Matt Dillahunty, former president of the Atheist Community of Austin, brings a critical perspective. He challenges the credibility of religious claims, arguing that advancements in science provide evidence-based answers, making faith in God unnecessary and irrational. This engaging conversation dives into topics like the cosmological argument, the meaning of life, and historical evidence for Jesus.

Whether you're a believer, skeptic, or curious observer, this debate will make you think deeply about faith, reason, and the evidence for God. Comment below on which argument resonated with you the most!

title: Cliffe Knechtle Debates Atheist Matt Dillahunty | Is There Life After Death?
description:
This debate between Cliffe Knechtle and Matt Dillahunty explores the critical question: Is belief in God rational? Cliffe Knechtle, a Christian apologist, argues in favor of God's existence, pointing to moral absolutes and historical evidence, such as the resurrection of Jesus Christ, as foundations for faith. Matt Dillahunty, a well-known atheist advocate, challenges these claims, emphasizing the need for empirical evidence and questioning the reliability of religious testimonies. Key topics include whether objective morality requires a divine source, the validity of miracles, and whether testimonies alone can prove extraordinary events. The debate also examines how personal experiences, such as alleged miracles, are interpreted differently by theists and skeptics. This lively exchange provides deep insights into Christian and atheist worldviews, making it a thought-provoking discussion for anyone interested in philosophy, theology, and the nature of belief.
